Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Felder.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Council Member Felder moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040415 MMK, an amendment to the City Map special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 050110 (A) ZRK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Greenpoint-Williamsburg Rezoning, Brooklyn (C040415MMK)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to domestic partnerships.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Domestic Partnerships

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact a commuter tax and direct funds to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to alleviate its budget deficit.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to enact a commuter tax and direct funds to the MTA to alleviate its budget deficit.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased uniformed correctional and sanitation workers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Health insurance coverage for the surviving spouse or domestic partner and children of deceased uniformed correctional and sanitation workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the preservation of hotels.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Preservation of Hotels

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Department of Correctional Services to adopt the New York City Department of Correction model of discharge planning.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Adopt the NYC Dep't of Correction model of discharge planning.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Food and Drug Administration to prohibit the sale of the drug Adderall.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Food and Drug Administration to prohibit the sale of the drug Adderall.

Items.Title: Resolution urging Governor Pataki and the New York State legislature to pass a budget for 2005-2006 that does not include the Flexible Fund for Family Services in the form proposed by the Governor and that adds a minimum of $300 million funding for core social services statewide.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: 2005-2006 budget that does not include the Flexible Fund for Family Services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Sanitation Department to sponsor a Tool Loan Program that stores tools year-round in the offices of participating elected officials, community boards, and community organizations that are loaned for short periods to residents and groups as part of an ongoing campaign to keep our neighborhoods clean and beautiful.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Sanitation Department to sponsor a Tool Loan Program

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to claims by owners of private property who have sustained damage caused by city-owned infrastructure.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Claims by owners of private property who have sustained damage caused by city-owned infrastructure.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to regularly updated online performance measures and statistics on city agencies.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Regularly updated online performance measures and statistics on city agencies.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that will expand the number of senior citizens who would be eligible to participate in the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Expand the number of senior citizens who would be eligible to participate in the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to area limitations on benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law relating to building services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Area limitations on benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law relating to building services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the exemption from taxes of certain multiple dwellings for certain lead based paint activities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Exemption from taxes of certain multiple dwellings for certain lead based paint activities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress and the President to maintain federal funding of the Community Services Block Grant (CSBG) and to renew our nation’s commitment to combat poverty, ameliorate racial and ethnic inequality and empower low-income communities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Maintain federal funding of the Community Services Block Grant (CSBG).

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to adopt legislation reinstating the death penalty in New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: NYS Assembly to adopt legislation reinstating the death penalty in NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the licensing of large retail stores.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Licensing of large retail stores.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Pheffer A.4683, “An Act to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to establishing a procedure for medical review in correction member disability cases.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to establishing a procedure for medical review in correction member disablity cases (A. 4683).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Stavisky S.2268 and Assembly Member McLaughlin A.4558, “AN ACT to amend the New York City charter, in relation to the confidentiality of information obtained by a city employee in the course of official duties.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to confidentiality of info obtained by city employee in the course of official duties (S.2268, A.4558)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Marchi S.2458 and Assembly Member Lavelle A.4978, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the benefits of the variable supplements fund for housing police and transit police members of the New York city employees’ retirement system.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to extending the benefits of variable supplements fund for housing and transit police members (S.2458, A.4978).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Sampson S.2158, “An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corporation, not withstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785 Lots No.1 and No.75 on the tax map of the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, to reconvey its interest in certain real property, acquired through in rem tax foreclosure, in Brooklyn to Elva McZeal Tenants Association Develoment Fund Corp.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer A.1099, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring child safety seats in taxicabs and liveries.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to requiring child safety seats in taxicabs and liveries (A.1099)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer A.1104, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of commercial bicyclists.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to regulation of commercial bicyclists (A.1104).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Stringer and Pheffer A.854, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for building code violations.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to penalties for building code violations (A.854).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer A.1403, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for a demonstration program for the fitting of taxicabs to accommodate the disabled.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to providing a demonstration program for the fitting of taxicabs to accommodate the disabled (A.1403).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer A.1594, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to liability insurance coverage for taxicabs and liveries, safety training for delinquent taxi drivers, and requiring taxis to display the taxi and limousine commission’s complaint number on their bumpers.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to taxi and liveries liability insurance, safety training and requiring TLC complaint number on bumpers (A.1594).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer A.1390, “An ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to stopping at the exits of parking garages in cities with a population of one million or more.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName:
AN ACT, in relation to stopping at exits of parking garages in cities with pop. 1 milion or more
(A.1390).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Stringer A.777, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the education law, in relation to reporting certain structural problems to the New York City Department of Buildings and penalties for noncompliance by licensed engineers.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, reporting structural problems to DOB and penalties for noncompliance by licensed engineers (A.777)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Dinowitz A.1255, “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to allowing citizens to issue tickets to designated officers and appointed employees of the parking violation bureau.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to allowing citizens to issue tickets to designated officers and appointed employees of the parking violations bureau (A.1255).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to area eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law within the borough of Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Area eligibility limitations on benefits pursuant to section four hundred twenty-one-a of the real property tax law within the borough of Brooklyn.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to ensure regular cleaning and maintenance of all public school bathrooms, and to post inspection forms recording the performance of such cleaning and maintenance in such bathrooms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to ensure regular cleaning and maintenance of all public school bathrooms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to limiting the issuance of notices of violations for litter during certain times to mixed use buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution mourning the death and celebrating the life of Peter Zvi Malkin, the man who captured Adolph Eichmann.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tem (Council Member Perkins) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tem  (Council Member Perkins) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Mourning the death and celebrating the life of Peter Zvi Malkin.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the date of issuance and publication by the Mayor of a ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the Mayor of the proposed executive budget and budget message, the date of submission by the Borough Presidents of recommendations in response to the Mayor’s executive budget, the date of publication of a report by the director of the independent budget office analyzing the executive budget, the date by which the Council hearings pertaining to the executive budget shall conclude, the date by which if the expense budget has not been adopted, the expense budget and tax rate adopted as modified for the current fiscal year shall be deemed to have been extended for the new fiscal year until such time as a new expense budget has been adopted, the date by which if a capital budget and a capital program have not been adopted, the unutilized portion of all prior capital appropriations shall be deemed reappropriated, the date of submission by the Mayor of an estimate of the probable amount of receipts, the date by which any person or organization may submit an official alternative estimate of revenues, the date by which if the Council has not fixed the tax rates for the ensuing fiscal year, the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to complete the assessment rolls using estimated rates, and related matters, relating to the fiscal year two thousand six.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Date of issuance and publication by the Mayor of a ten-year capital strategy, the date of submission by the Mayor of the proposed executive budget and budget message, the date of submission by the Borough Presidents of recommendations.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tem (Council Member Perkins) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Presidet Pro Tem (Council Member Perkins) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: 
Int 149-A.

See files for individual votes.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Miller) voted affirmative on the General Orders and had to leave the Meeting; he delegated his podium to the Majority Leader (Council Member Rivera) as Acting Speaker for the rest of the proceedings.
